condition.title: Problem
condition.p: The browser freeze with load spinner when opening a document or takes too long.

cause.title: Cause
cause.p: There are a lot of reasons that can lead to a big load time like slow internet connection, bad customization that interferes with the document load process, big document, etc.

steps-informal.p: Troubleshoot the requests made by the server by enabling verbose HTTP logs:

ol.li: open a document that takes long to load in Web Author in Google Chrome
open Developer Tools (e.g. by pressing F12)
disable the "Disable cache" checkbox in Network tab
right click on a request and "Save all as HAR with content"
sort requests by time (e.g. right click, Sort, Time)
look for the longest requests, inspect the URL and try to find if they are made because of a customization (custom plugin or framework)
if nothing relevant arise, report the downloaded HAR to our support email address

steps-informal.p: Troubleshoot the requests made by the server by enabling verbose HTTP logs:

ol.li: enable verbose HTTP logs by following the procedure from Enabling HTTP Request Logging for Debugging
open server logs by following the procedure from How to Locate the Log File and the Log Configuration Fileâ€‹
see the longs and try to find the ones that take long time on server
if nothing relevant arise, report the found logs to our support email address
open server logs by following the procedure from How to Locate the Log File and the Log Configuration File
look for "Requests took too long" and see the URL of the requests that takes long time on server
if nothing relevant arise, report the found logs to our support email address
